Title: the beta test initiation

Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is making a video.
Siri, I’m in the mood for gelato.
Sheldon: Hello. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and welcome to the premiere episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Over the next 52 weeks, you and I are going to explore the dynamic world of vexillology.
Vexillology is the study of flags.
Did you have fun doing it?

Fun and information are two sides to this video podcast, not unlike the only two-sided state flag, Oregon. Oh, look. Hello, Mr. Beaver. In future episodes, we’ll answer some burning questions. What’s the only non-rectangular flag? What animal appears most often on flags? What animal appears second most often on flags? And more.
Why are you waving a white flag?
Cut. Did you not see we are rolling?
And I have flag knowledge that I have to get out of here!

No, I’m a little rattled. But like the flag over Fort Sumter, I’m still here. And, take two. Hello. I’m Dr. Sheldon Cooper, and welcome to the premiere episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags. Over the next 52 weeks, you and I are going to explore the dynamic world of vexillology.
Vexillology is… why is there a face on that flag?
Confound it! You’re right, it’s brilliant. Let’s take it from the top.
Cut! Take 47.
Here’s an interesting fact about flags.

The flags of Liechtenstein and Haiti were identical by coincidence, a fact that wasn’t discovered until they competed against each other at the 1936 Olympics. And thankfully, their embarrassment was overshadowed by the rise of Fascism.

Speaking of cowboys, do you know what country has not one but two cows on its flag? The tiny landlocked nation of Andorra. Oh, the next classic episode of Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun with Flags is writing itself.
Careful, it’s that kind of sass that can get a person uninvited to this year’s Who Con.
All right, that’s it. Who Con, you’re out.
How about constantly talks with food in her mouth?
Well done, Dr. Koothrappali.
You’ve taken a great evolutionary leap by abandoning human interaction and allowing yourself to romantically bond with a soulless machine. Kudos.
Oh, no, of course. I understand. You’re afraid the world isn’t ready for your taboo love. Your secret’s safe with me.
Kripke.
Guten Tag, das YouTube. Ich bin ein Bavarian.
Und dis is Sheldon Cooper Presents Fun…
Flags.
Amy: Hang on, Dr. C. What’s vexillology?
Cool. I think I just learned something.
Hang on, Dr. Cooper. What’s vexillology?
It’s Ferdinand T. Flag. I thought he might help bring in some younger viewers.
For someone who has a machine that can travel anywhere in time and space, Doctor Who sure does have a thing for modern-day London.
What’s baffling me is what you could’ve possibly put on the list. Hair too golden? Laugh too musical? World too much a better place for her mere presence in it?
Her heart’s full of love, no one cares what’s in her mouth.
Sheldon: Now, today\u2019s episode of Fu: you gotta know how to hold ’em, you gotta know how to fold ’em. Let’s start by identifying the parts of our flag. This edge is the hoist, and it’s used to…
Leonard: Excuse me, sorry, excuse me.
Sorry. I’m having dinner with Penny. I have to get out of here.
Me, too, I missed you.
Well, yeah, sex with you is pretty great. Have you ever tried it?
Oh, I can take it slow. Did I ever tell you about my first girlfriend in high school, Karen Berberick? To this day she doesn’t know we were going out. Made it easier on her when I broke things off.
How about this, are you familiar with the typical development for computer software?

Before an application is released, they give it a trial run. W-We could do that. And if we hit a rough spot, instead of getting mad, just say, hey, we found a bug, and we report it so it can be fixed.
Well, technically, this would be an alpha test. A beta test requires people that weren’t involved in the development of the appli…
No, you should. Absolutely. That was me being pedantic. That’s our first bug. You reported it. I can fix that. See? This is good.
Great. You keep a list, I’ll keep a list. At some point, we’ll exchange.
Night. Attaboy, Hofstadter. Nothing gets the ladies hotter than software development analogies. Hey, I’m back.
Um, I’m not sure, but I think the right answer here is no.
Even Doctor Who?
Okay, bug report taken. Next time I will have a better plan for our evening’s activity.
Oh, wait, here, almost forgot. Here.
My bug report to you.
It’s colour coded.
Uh, red means fix right away. Yellow is eh, whenever you get a chance. And green is I could probably learn to live with it. There’s a key down here at the bottom. It’s neat, huh?
So, have a good night.
Look at that. Some day, we will tell future generations that dating used to be hard.
Hey. You ready to go?
Can you finish it later?
Great. Good. Great. What are you reading?

They kind of spoil the ending right in the name of that, don’t they? All right. Look, just remember how this works. We don’t get mad about these things. Uh, speaking of which, I’ve addressed your bug report on my date planning. Got a really fun evening for you. It’s kind of a surprise.
Thank you.

All right, fair enough. I certainly can be quieter when we kiss. I thought it was an expression of passion, but if it’s coming across as juicy and weird, who wants that? Uh, uh, I’m sorry, can you be more specific on how my eyebrows are stupid? Nah, never mind, it’s right here.
I called your dad. I asked him what things you liked to do when you were a kid. This seemed easier than getting a cow out here so you could tip it.
You mean for a person whose neck massages feel like an eagle is trying to carry you to its nest?
Right. Sorry, sorry.
Right. Sorry.
I play a lot of Grand Theft Auto. I think I know how to handle a gat.
So, I’ve got a gunshot wound. That’s pretty badass.
Hello? They gave me a Band-Aid. Hospitals do not issue Band-Aids unless it is medically necessary. That is the law.
Thank you for hiding my Star Wars socks at the emergency room. Is it a good time to evaluate the beta test and see where we stand?
So, are we still taking things slow? Because a gunshot wound today, last week, I slammed my thumb in the kitchen drawer. We don’t know how much time I have.
Penny: That was a really nice dinner. I’m glad you asked me out again.
You see me all the time. You sure you just don’t miss the sex?
I have. You are not wrong. I just think if we’re gonna try dating again, we should take things slow.
Okay, well, maybe not that slow.
You know, just for fun, let’s say I’m not.
You mean like a beta test?
Seriously, do I not get credit for knowing beta test?
All right. Let’s give it a shot.
Okay. Good night, Leonard.
Uh, we’re not counting this as a date, are we?
Even Doctor Who.
Well, thank you. I’ll see you tomorrow.
What’s this?
Well, that’s quite a list you got there.
Oh.
Yep.
Yep.
It’s open.
Yeah, hang on. Let me just finish this chapter.
No, I can’t. Reading books is a big part of my life now because, you know, we’d have more fun things to talk about if I read more.
Two Weeks to Rock Hard Abs.
All right. Terrific. Well, let me just go find a pair of shoes that aren’t so tall. We wouldn’t want you to feel like you were out for a walk with your mommy.
Yeah. Oh. Here’s my list for you, right there.
This is amazing. How did you even get this idea?
Okay, you’re kind of really great.
Okay, bug report. I just complimented you. You should take it and shut up.
And stop apologizing all the time.
All right, let’s shoot stuff. You want me to show you what to do?
Wow. You are cute when you get all gangsta. (Kisses him. Leonard accidentally shoots himself in the foot.)
No, you’ve got a Reebok with a gunshot wound and an ouchie on your pinkie toe.
Well, thank you for a really cool evening.
Things are looking good.
Good night, you.
Raj: I will take that action.
I stopped on the way to work. Hey, do you want to peel the plastic off with me?
Grab a corner. Whoa, what’s your hurry, cowboy? Savour the moment.
Hey, I let you peel the plastic, don’t get greedy. (To phone) Hello?
What’s your name?
Are you single?
Yeah, you’re right, that’s too personal. We hardly know each other. How about a cup of coffee?
I will see you gentlemen later.
So, Siri, what’s happening? How are you?
What are you doing right now?
You have a beautiful voice.
I bet it is. Why don’t women like me?
No need. I’ve already done that. Siri, do you have a last name?
Ah, one name. Like, uh, Cher, Madonna, Adele. All the women who rock me. My name is Rajesh, but you can call me Raj.
I’d like you to call me sexy.
Okay.
Thank you, darling.
I’m sorry?
I haven’t bonded with it.
It’s just a phone.
Thanks, Barry. Siri, remind me Friday morning to make my famous popovers.
Hey, don’t talk to her like that. She’s a lady.
Good timing. Dinner’s almost ready.
Oh, an exotic little treat. I was just talking to Siri about Peking duck, and she said she knew about four Chinese grocers, two of which were fairly close to me. Her spontaneity is contagious.

Can I pour you some wine? I think you’ll enjoy it. The traditional choice with Peking duck is a Sauvignon Blanc, but Siri suggested an off-dry Riesling. I wasn’t sure, but I didn’t want to have an argument with her in the middle of Trader Joe’s. Now, what should we put Siri in for dinner? Leopard, sparkles, or to paraphrase Coco Chanel, you can never go wrong with a little black case. Siri, play some smooth jazz.
Oh, my God, Kenny G? This woman can read me like a book. I can’t believe I bought my soul mate at Glendale Galleria.
Thank you. (Enters a door marked “The Office of Siri” Inside is a red-headed woman sitting at a huge console desk.)
Howard: Really? Me? That’s, like, the best part.
Oh, let me try the voice recognition.
Look at that. There’s finally a woman in your life you can talk to.
She is gonna break his heart.
Siri: I don’t have a marital status, if that’s what you’re asking.
I’ve found six coffee shops. Three of them are fairly close to you.
What am I doing? I’m talking with you.
Thank you, it’s nice to be appreciated.
Let me check on that. How about a Web search for why don’t women like me?”
Would you like me to call you Raj?
From now on, I’ll call you sexy. Okay?
(chimes) I found ten restaurants whose reviews mention gelato. Seven of them are fairly close to you.
You are most certainly welcome, sexy.

Dave, I found six vacuum cleaner repair shops in your area. Four are fairly close to you. (To Raj) Hello, sexy. What can I help you with? If you’d like to make love to me, just tell me. (Raj tries to speak) I’m sorry. I don’t understand.
Penny: Bug report: When a guy asks me to spend time with him, maybe he plans something a little more interesting than hanging out at home, watching TV.
Barry: Heads up. Pwofessor Wothman urinated in the particle physics wab again, so we’re going to move up his wetirement party. Fwiday, five o’cwock, pot wuck.
Wisten to me. Not westauwant, westauwant.
See? Total cwap. You suck, Siwi.
Well, that wady took high-wes pictures of my junk wast night for Cwaigswist. Waiter.
Barry (to his own phone): You got Siwi, huh? Voice wecognition on that thing is tewible. Wook. Siwi, can you wecommend a westauwant?
Barry\u2019s Siri: I’m sorry, Bawwy. I don’t understand wecommend a westauwant.
I don’t know what you mean by not westauwant, westauwant.
Bernadette: Who’s Siri? Is he dating somebody new?
Oh. Is that cute or creepy?
I don’t know if I want to stay.
